course.description_en: Discover different types of weather and how they make us feel. Learn about sun, rain, wind, and clouds through fun stories and safe activities.
course.description_ar: اكتشف أنواع الطقس المختلفة وكيف تجعلنا نشعر. تعلم عن الشمس والمطر والرياح والغيوم من خلال القصص الممتعة والأنشطة الآمنة.
course.subject: science

content_data.title: Mr. Sun Comes Out to Play
content_data.content: Look up at the sky! Do you see the bright yellow sun? The sun is warm. The sun is bright. The sun makes light. When the sun shines, it is a sunny day. On sunny days, we feel happy. We can play outside. We can see everything clearly. The sun helps flowers grow. The sun makes us warm. But the sun is very hot! We must be careful. We wear hats in the sun. We stay in shade sometimes. The sun is our friend when we are safe!
learning_objectives: Understand the sun gives light and warmth

vocabulary_words.definition: Big bright yellow circle in the sky that gives light
When the sun is shining and it's bright outside
Having lots of light, easy to see
Nice feeling, not cold
Cool place where sun doesn't shine
Thing you wear on your head to stay safe

materials_needed: Yellow circle cut from paper (to represent sun)
Hat for child to try on
content_data.parent_guidance: Point to the sun outside if it's visible (never let child look directly at sun). Use flashlight to show how sun gives light. Let child feel warmth from sunny window. Practice putting on hat. Talk about sunny day activities like going to park.
safety_notes: Never look directly at the real sun
Keep flashlight away from eyes
Ensure hat fits properly and safely
Always supervise outdoor sun activities
Teach importance of shade and sun protection
discussion_questions: What color is the sun?
How does sunny weather make you feel?
What do we wear to stay safe in the sun?

extension_activities.title: Sun Safety Practice
extension_activities.description: Practice putting on hat and sunglasses (if available) for sun protection.

extension_activities.title: Sunny Day Drawing
extension_activities.description: Draw a big yellow sun with crayons on paper.

content_data.title: Little Raindrops Fall Down
content_data.content: Look outside! Gray clouds are in the sky. The raindrops fall down. Pitter patter, pitter patter! Rain comes from clouds. Rain is water from the sky. On rainy days, we stay inside. We watch rain through the window. Rain helps plants grow. Rain fills up puddles. Rain makes everything clean. We wear raincoats when we go outside. We use umbrellas to stay dry. Rain sounds peaceful. Listen to the gentle rain!
learning_objectives: Learn what to wear in rain

vocabulary_words.definition: Water drops that fall from clouds in the sky
When rain is falling from the sky
Gray or white fluffy things in the sky that hold water
Small drops of water that fall from clouds
Thing that keeps rain off you
Small pools of water on the ground

materials_needed: Spray bottle with water (parent use only)
content_data.parent_guidance: If it's raining, watch through window together. Use spray bottle to gently demonstrate rain (away from child's face). Let child hold umbrella safely. Practice putting on raincoat. Make 'pitter patter' sounds together.
safety_notes: Never use spray bottle near child's face
Ensure umbrella has no sharp points
Keep child away from windows during storms
Make sure raincoat isn't too large (tripping hazard)
Always supervise umbrella play
discussion_questions: What sound does rain make?
Where does rain come from?
What do we use to stay dry in rain?

extension_activities.title: Rain Sound Making
extension_activities.description: Tap fingers gently on table to make rain sounds: pitter patter.

extension_activities.title: Raindrop Art
extension_activities.description: Use blue finger paint dots to make raindrops on paper.

content_data.title: Wind Makes Everything Move
content_data.content: Feel the wind! Wind is moving air. We cannot see wind, but we can feel it. Wind makes leaves dance. Wind makes flags wave. Wind makes our hair move. Let's be like things in the wind! Wave your arms like tree branches. Sway back and forth gently. Move like leaves falling down. Wind can be gentle. Wind can be strong. On windy days, we hold grown-up's hand outside. Let's dance like the wind!

vocabulary_words.definition: Moving air that we can feel but cannot see
When wind is blowing and moving things around
Green parts that grow on trees
Move your body to music or for fun
Move gently back and forth
Soft and careful, not rough

content_data.parent_guidance: Use fan on lowest setting to let child feel moving air (keep fan away from child). Wave scarf to show wind movement. Do movements together - swaying, arm waving. Keep all movements gentle and controlled.
safety_notes: Keep fan away from child - parent holds only
Ensure open space for movement
Keep movements gentle to avoid falls
Hold child's hand during swaying if needed
Use only soft, safe materials for wind demonstration
discussion_questions: Can you feel the wind?
What does wind make move?
How do trees move in the wind?

extension_activities.title: Scarf Wind Dance
extension_activities.description: Wave lightweight scarf or tissue to see how wind moves things.

extension_activities.title: Wind Observation
extension_activities.description: Look outside to see what wind is moving (trees, flags, leaves).

content_data.title: Clouds Float in the Blue Sky
content_data.content: Look up at the sky! Do you see white fluffy clouds? Clouds are made of tiny water drops. Clouds float in the sky. Some clouds are white and fluffy. Some clouds are gray and full of rain. Clouds move slowly across the sky. Clouds have different shapes. Some look like animals. Some look like cotton balls. Clouds are fun to watch. They change shapes as they move. Clouds help make weather. White clouds mean nice weather!
learning_objectives: Understand clouds are made of water
Learn clouds come in different shapes

vocabulary_words.definition: White or gray fluffy things that float in the sky
Soft and light like cotton or pillows
Stay up in the air without falling
Different forms like circles, squares, or animals
Soft white fluffy material
Go from one place to another

materials_needed: Window or safe outdoor viewing area
content_data.parent_guidance: Point out real clouds outside if visible. Let child touch cotton balls to feel 'fluffy' texture. Help child make cloud shapes with cotton balls on blue paper. Talk about different cloud shapes you see together.
safety_notes: Supervise outdoor cloud watching
Keep cotton balls large enough to prevent choking
Ensure child doesn't put cotton in mouth
Use safe viewing area away from traffic
Don't look directly at sun while cloud watching
discussion_questions: What do clouds feel like?
What colors can clouds be?
What shapes do you see in the clouds?

extension_activities.title: Cotton Ball Clouds
extension_activities.description: Glue cotton balls on blue paper to make a sky with clouds.

extension_activities.title: Cloud Shape Game
extension_activities.description: Look at clouds and guess what shapes they look like (animals, objects).

content_data.title: White Snowflakes Fall Like Magic
content_data.content: Brrr! It's cold outside. Look! White snowflakes fall from the sky. Snow is frozen water from clouds. Each snowflake is different. Snow covers the ground like a white blanket. Snow makes everything look magical. We wear warm clothes in snow. We wear coats and mittens. We wear boots to keep feet warm. Let's pretend to be snowflakes! Spin around slowly. Float down gently. Land softly on the ground. Snow is fun but very cold!

vocabulary_words.definition: White frozen water that falls from clouds when it's very cold
Small white pieces of snow that fall from the sky
Not warm, makes you want to wear a coat
Water that got so cold it became hard and white
Warm coverings for hands in cold weather
Special and wonderful like in fairy tales

materials_needed: White paper cut into snowflake shapes
Winter clothes to try on (coat, mittens, hat)
White cotton balls or tissue paper
content_data.parent_guidance: Show winter clothes and let child try them on. Demonstrate gentle spinning and floating movements. Use white paper pieces to show how snowflakes fall. If it's snowing outside, watch safely through window.
safety_notes: Keep spinning movements very gentle to prevent dizziness
Ensure winter clothes fit properly and aren't tripping hazards
Hold child's hand during spinning if needed
Keep paper pieces large enough to prevent choking
Never let child play in real snow without proper supervision and clothing
discussion_questions: What color is snow?
What do we wear when it's cold and snowy?
How do snowflakes move in the air?

extension_activities.title: Paper Snowflake Drop
extension_activities.description: Drop white paper pieces and watch them 'fall like snow'.

extension_activities.title: Winter Clothes Dress-Up
extension_activities.description: Practice putting on winter clothes like coats, hats, and mittens.

content_data.title: Things That Help Us in Different Weather
content_data.content: Different weather needs different helpers! In sunny weather, we use hats and sunglasses. In rainy weather, we use umbrellas and raincoats. In windy weather, we hold hands with grown-ups. In cold weather, we wear warm coats. Let's practice using weather helpers! Put on a hat for sunny days. Open an umbrella for rainy days. Put on a coat for cold days. Weather helpers keep us safe and comfortable. We are smart to use the right helpers!
learning_objectives: Match weather helpers to weather types
Understand how to stay safe in different weather

vocabulary_words.definition: Things that help us stay safe and comfortable
Dark glasses that protect eyes from bright sun
Feeling good and cozy, not too hot or cold
Keep safe from harm
Do something over and over to get better
Making good choices and thinking well

content_data.parent_guidance: Show each weather helper and let child practice using them. Make it a game - show weather picture and ask child to pick the right helper. Practice putting items on and taking them off safely.
safety_notes: Ensure all items are child-appropriate size
Check that umbrella has no sharp points
Make sure clothes aren't too large (tripping hazard)
Supervise trying on all items
Use only safe, unbreakable sunglasses if available
discussion_questions: What do we wear on sunny days?
What helps us stay dry in rain?
How do we stay warm when it's cold?

extension_activities.title: Weather Helper Match Game
extension_activities.description: Match pictures of weather with the right helper items.

extension_activities.title: Dress for Weather Game
extension_activities.description: Parent calls out weather type, child finds and puts on right helper.

content_data.title: What Do You Know About Weather?
content_data.content: Let's play a fun weather game! I will ask you about different types of weather. You can point to pictures or show me with actions!
learning_objectives: Show understanding through actions and words

vocabulary_words.definition: Fun game with questions to show what you learned
Moving your body to show something

materials_needed: Child's hands for pointing and actions
content_data.parent_guidance: Ask questions slowly and give child time to think. Accept pointing, actions, or simple words as answers. Celebrate every response. Use pictures and items to help child answer.
safety_notes: Keep quiz short and fun
No pressure for perfect answers
Take breaks if child gets tired or frustrated
discussion_questions: Point to the sun! What weather does the sun make?
What falls from clouds when it's rainy?
Show me how trees move in the wind!
What color are fluffy clouds?
What do we wear when it's cold and snowy?
What helps us stay dry in the rain?

extension_activities.title: Weather Actions Game
extension_activities.description: Do actions for each weather type - shine like sun, fall like rain, sway like wind.

extension_activities.title: Weather Picture Story
extension_activities.description: Tell a simple story using weather pictures.

content_data.title: Celebrating All Types of Weather
content_data.content: Let's celebrate all the weather we learned about! First, let's be the bright sun! Stretch your arms wide and smile big. Next, let's be gentle rain! Wiggle your fingers as raindrops fall down. Then, let's be the wind! Sway and move like leaves in the breeze. Now, let's be fluffy clouds! Float and move slowly across the sky. Finally, let's be snowflakes! Spin gently and land softly. All weather is special! Sun gives us light. Rain helps plants grow. Wind moves things around. Clouds make shapes in the sky. Snow makes everything magical. You know so much about weather! You are a weather expert!
learning_objectives: Review all weather types through movement
Understand each weather type is important

vocabulary_words.definition: Be happy about something special we learned
Someone who knows a lot about something
Make your arms and body long and wide
Gentle, soft wind that feels nice
Important and wonderful
Really matters and helps us

materials_needed: All weather helper items from previous lessons
content_data.parent_guidance: Join in all the movements enthusiastically! Do each weather action together. Celebrate child's learning with praise. Take photos if desired. Make it feel like a real celebration of their weather knowledge.
safety_notes: Ensure safe space for all movements
Keep spinning gentle to prevent dizziness
Hold child's hand during movements if needed
Take breaks between different weather actions
Keep music at safe volume levels
discussion_questions: Which weather is your favorite?
What does each type of weather do to help us?
Can you name all the weather types we learned?

extension_activities.title: Weather Book Creation
extension_activities.description: Make a simple book with drawings of all weather types learned.

extension_activities.title: Weather Report Game
extension_activities.description: Child can 'report' the weather outside like on TV.

extension_activities.title: Weather Dance Party
extension_activities.description: Dance and move like different weather types to music.
